articles.title: World Cup loss raises doubts about Argentina’s fitness
articles.description: Romero and Paredes were substituted soon after Saudi Arabia's second goal in the 53rd was an indication something was not right.
articles.content:
Unfortunately for Argentina fans, it wasn’t just a bad dream. Their team really did lose 2-1 to Saudi Arabia in one of the biggest shocks in the World Cup’s 92-year history.
Now the pressure is on Lionel Messi and Argentina, who cannot afford to lose... [3919 chars]

articles.title: Lionel Messi fronts up to defeat after World Cup shock
articles.description: Argentina's game against Saudi Arabia on Tuesday was supposed to serve as the perfect springboard for Lionel Messi's last dance at the World Cup.
articles.content:
Doha, Qatar CNN —
Argentina’s game against Saudi Arabia on Tuesday was supposed to serve as the perfect springboard for Lionel Messi’s last dance at the World Cup.

articles.title: Saudi Arabia's win over Argentina is the greatest upset
articles.description: Argentina won the World Cup in 1978 and 1986, but at Qatar 2022, it made history in a different way. Gracenote calls Argentina's 2-1
articles.content:
Saudi Arabia’s win over Argentina is the greatest upset
Argentina won the World Cup in 1978 and 1986.
At Qatar 2022, it made history in a different way.
Argentina’s 2-1 loss to Saudi Arabia in Group C was the biggest World Cup upset.

articles.title: Brazil, Argentina football fans fight it out in Kerala, video surfaces online
articles.description: The brawl between impassioned fans took place in Kerala’s Kollam district, ahead of the Qatar World Cup inaugural ceremony.
articles.content: When it comes to football fever, no place is as charged up as Kerala. Now with the ongoing FIFA World Cup, the fans are more invested in the sport than ever. Ahead of the opening ceremony of the Qatar World Cup, a clash broke out in Kerala’s Kollam d... [2685 chars]

articles.title: World Cup 2022 LIVE: Luka Modric and Hakim Ziyech start as Croatia face Morocco
articles.description: The fourth day of the World Cup has a lot to live up to following France's thumping win over Australia and Argentina's shock defeat to Saudi Arabia, but tournament heavyweights Germany and Spain are set for action
articles.content:
Day four of the World Cup certainly has a lot to live up to after headlines were made both in and away from Qatar on Tuesday.

articles.title: Argentina left furious as theory emerges over FIFA and VAR mistake at World Cup
articles.description: Saudi Arabia rocked world football with a historic 2-1 win against Argentina, but Lionel Messi and Co have been left fuming after a mistake from VAR emerged following their disastrous World Cup opener
articles.content:
Argentina have had salt rubbed in their wounds after it emerged that VAR made a remarkable error during their disastrous 2-1 defeat to Saudi Arabia.
Lionel Messi and Co were stunned in their World Cup opener, as Herve Renard 's side came from behind ... [3104 chars]

articles.title: Wounded Argentina must put Saudi trauma behind them
articles.description: Lionel Messi's Argentina must put aside injured pride after a shock defeat by Saudi Arabia and summon the fighting spirit of their similarly-bruised 1990 predecessors if they want to bring home the World Cup for a third time.
